com.azure.storage.blob

Class BlobServiceClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.azure.storage.blob.BlobServiceClient

  • public final class BlobServiceClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client to a storage account. It may only be instantiated through a BlobServiceClientBuilder. This class does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers.

    This client contains operations on a blob. Operations on a container are available on ContainerClient through BlobServiceClient.getContainerClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobClient.

    Please see here for more information on containers.

    • Method Detail

      • getContainerClient

        public ContainerClient getContainerClient(java.lang.String containerName)
        Initializes a ContainerClient object pointing to the specified container. This method does not create a container. It simply constructs the URL to the container and offers access to methods relevant to containers.
        Parameters:
        containerName - The name of the container to point to.
        Returns:
        A ContainerClient object pointing to the specified container

      • createContainer

        public Response<ContainerClient> createContainer(java.lang.String containerName)
        Creates a new container within a storage account. If a container with the same name already exists, the operation fails. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container to create
        Returns:
        A response containing a ContainerClient used to interact with the container created.

      • createContainer

        public Response<ContainerClient> createContainer(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                 Metadata metadata,
                                                 PublicAccessType accessType)
        Creates a new container within a storage account. If a container with the same name already exists, the operation fails. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container to create
        metadata - Metadata
        accessType - Specifies how the data in this container is available to the public. See the x-ms-blob-public-access header in the Azure Docs for more information. Pass null for no public access.
        Returns:
        A response containing a ContainerClient used to interact with the container created.

      • deleteContainer

        public VoidResponse deleteContainer(java.lang.String containerName)
        Deletes the specified container in the storage account. If the container doesn't exist the operation fails. For more information see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the container to delete
        Returns:
        A response containing status code and HTTP headers

      • getAccountUrl

        public java.net.URL getAccountUrl()
        Gets the URL of the storage account represented by this client.
        Returns:
        the URL.

      • listContainers

        public java.lang.Iterable<ContainerItem> listContainers()
        Returns a lazy loaded list of containers in this account. The returned Iterable can be iterated through while new items are automatically retrieved as needed. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        The list of containers.

      • listContainers

        public java.lang.Iterable<ContainerItem> listContainers(ListContainersOptions options,
                                                        java.time.Duration timeout)
        Returns a lazy loaded list of containers in this account. The returned Iterable can be iterated through while new items are automatically retrieved as needed. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        options - A ListContainersOptions which specifies what data should be returned by the service.
        timeout - An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.
        Returns:
        The list of containers.

      • setProperties

        public VoidResponse setProperties(StorageServiceProperties properties)
        Sets properties for a storage account's Blob service endpoint. For more information, see the Azure Docs. Note that setting the default service version has no effect when using this client because this client explicitly sets the version header on each request, overriding the default.
        Parameters:
        properties - Configures the service.
        Returns:
        The storage account properties.

      • setProperties

        public VoidResponse setProperties(StorageServiceProperties properties,
                                  java.time.Duration timeout)
        Sets properties for a storage account's Blob service endpoint. For more information, see the Azure Docs. Note that setting the default service version has no effect when using this client because this client explicitly sets the version header on each request, overriding the default.
        Parameters:
        properties - Configures the service.
        timeout - An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.
        Returns:
        The storage account properties.

      • getUserDelegationKey

        public Response<UserDelegationKey> getUserDelegationKey(java.time.OffsetDateTime start,
                                                        java.time.OffsetDateTime expiry)
        Gets a user delegation key for use with this account's blob storage. Note: This method call is only valid when using TokenCredential in this object's HttpPipeline.
        Parameters:
        start - Start time for the key's validity. Null indicates immediate start.
        expiry - Expiration of the key's validity.
        Returns:
        The user delegation key.

      • getUserDelegationKey

        public Response<UserDelegationKey> getUserDelegationKey(java.time.OffsetDateTime start,
                                                        java.time.OffsetDateTime expiry,
                                                        java.time.Duration timeout)
        Gets a user delegation key for use with this account's blob storage. Note: This method call is only valid when using TokenCredential in this object's HttpPipeline.
        Parameters:
        start - Start time for the key's validity. Null indicates immediate start.
        expiry - Expiration of the key's validity.
        timeout - An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.
        Returns:
        The user delegation key.

      • getStatistics

        public Response<StorageServiceStats> getStatistics()
        Retrieves statistics related to replication for the Blob service. It is only available on the secondary location endpoint when read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled for the storage account. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Returns:
        The storage account statistics.

      • getStatistics

        public Response<StorageServiceStats> getStatistics(java.time.Duration timeout)
        Retrieves statistics related to replication for the Blob service. It is only available on the secondary location endpoint when read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled for the storage account. For more information, see the Azure Docs.
        Parameters:
        timeout - An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.
        Returns:
        The storage account statistics.

      • generateAccountSAS

        public java.lang.String generateAccountSAS(com.azure.storage.blob.AccountSASService accountSASService,
                                           com.azure.storage.blob.AccountSASResourceType accountSASResourceType,
                                           com.azure.storage.blob.AccountSASPermission accountSASPermission,
                                           java.time.OffsetDateTime expiryTime)
        Generates an account SAS token with the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        accountSASService - The AccountSASService services for the account SAS
        accountSASResourceType - An optional AccountSASResourceType resources for the account SAS
        accountSASPermission - The AccountSASPermission permission for the account SAS
        expiryTime - The OffsetDateTime expiry time for the account SAS
        Returns:
        A string that represents the SAS token

      • generateAccountSAS

        public java.lang.String generateAccountSAS(com.azure.storage.blob.AccountSASService accountSASService,
                                           com.azure.storage.blob.AccountSASResourceType accountSASResourceType,
                                           com.azure.storage.blob.AccountSASPermission accountSASPermission,
                                           java.time.OffsetDateTime expiryTime,
                                           java.time.OffsetDateTime startTime,
                                           java.lang.String version,
                                           com.azure.storage.blob.IPRange ipRange,
                                           com.azure.storage.blob.SASProtocol sasProtocol)
        Generates an account SAS token with the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        accountSASService - The AccountSASService services for the account SAS
        accountSASResourceType - An optional AccountSASResourceType resources for the account SAS
        accountSASPermission - The AccountSASPermission permission for the account SAS
        expiryTime - The OffsetDateTime expiry time for the account SAS
        startTime - The OffsetDateTime start time for the account SAS
        version - The String version for the account SAS
        ipRange - An optional IPRange ip address range for the SAS
        sasProtocol - An optional SASProtocol protocol for the SAS
        Returns:
        A string that represents the SAS token
